contentItem.text: Ospreys are raptors and are great at catching fish. They have incredible eyesight – 5 times better than ours. This amazing creature power helps them see through the water’s surface and spot the shadowy silhouettes of the fish below. When they see a fish, they dive, bringing their legs and talons forward midway through the descent, hitting the water and hopefully scooping up a meal!
Ospreys always live near water and love all kinds of fish. Taking ones as big as they can carry away. But when fish are not available, they will also go after small mammals, reptiles, and birds.
Osprey live near bodies of water almost all over the world except on the continent of Antarctica.
Adult osprey don’t have natural predators, however, owls and eagles will take juveniles. Foxes, raccoons, and snakes all prey on osprey nests!

Osprey talons have a reversible outer toe which helps them hold on to the slippery fish they catch. They have a unique way of carrying their prey. Osprey will almost always turn the fish in their talons so that it faces forward. As this reduces wind resistance, it makes it easier for them to fly back home with their catch.
